title: Why does soap do a better job in cleaning greasy surfaces? - Quora

response.answer_text: It breaks down chemically the structure of the grease. It reduces water's surface tension making it wetter(seriously soap makes water wetter) It helps the water put the grease into solution acting as a link between the water and the grease.

Because it is a surfactant. Anionic surfactant. A kind of detergent. Its micels have lipophilic and lipofobic ends. At CMC the orientation of micels starts. Like magnetic deflection it pushes oil particles away. Simple.
